title: When Segmentation Meets Hyperspectral Image: New Paradigm for Hyperspectral Image Classification
author: Weilian Zhou (Waseda University), Weixuan Xie (Waseda University), Sei-ichiro Kamata (Waseda University), Man Sing Wong (Hong Kong Polytechnic University), Huiying (Cynthia) Hou (Hong Kong Polytechnic University), Haipeng Wang (Fudan University), ..., Sei-ichiro Kamata (Waseda University)
relevance_why: The integration of segmentation techniques with hyperspectral image classification might inform approaches to audio-visual or multi-modal integration tasks, especially in generating structured representations.
background: Hyperspectral image classification assigns semantic labels to individual pixels based on multi-band spectral data from remote sensing applications.
contribution: This study introduces a framework combining segmentation techniques and hyperspectral image analysis, enhancing classification performance through a novel Dynamic Shifted Regional Transformer.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous methods relied on small patch-based classifiers which limited spatial contextual understanding and often resulted in noise-like errors.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work employs segmentation models to provide a larger receptive field for better structural recognition and integrates adaptive pseudo-labeling to leverage unlabeled data effectively.

key_innovation: Utilizes segmentation-driven architectures to address inherent limitations of traditional small patch approaches in hyperspectral image classification.
real_world_impact: The proposed framework could significantly enhance land-cover mapping accuracy in remote sensing applications, improving decision-making across sectors like agriculture and environmental monitoring.
limitations: Some challenges include the high dimensionality of hyperspectral data which can be computationally intensive.

new_terms.hyperspectral image: **Hyperspectral image (HSI)** refers to images captured across many spectral bands, providing detailed spectral information for each pixel, utilized in diverse remote sensing applications.
new_terms.Dynamic Shifted Regional Transformer (DS: **Dynamic Shifted Regional Transformer (DSRT)** is a new architectural component that aggregates local and global features effectively, enhancing contextual understanding in image processing.
